noun.description: A nomination for an honor, award, etc.
examples: she isn't the the only star to receive an Oscar nom for her first feature film role

verb.description: Nominate for an honor, award, etc.
examples: Inception was nommed for an Oscar but lost out to The King's Speech

exclamation.description: Used to express pleasure at eating, or at the prospect of eating.
examples: chili and cornbread for dinner, nom nom!
I love pizza. Nom nom nom
Try the mac and cheese! Nom!
tempura shrimp, lettuce, cucumber, spicy mayo—om nom nom
there were all kinds of nom noms—onion rings, hot dogs, burgers, and fries
a Mexican restaurant that serves noms like sweet potato empanadas

origin: Early 21st century: probably imitative but apparently also popularized by the noises made by the Cookie Monster character in the children's television programSesame Street. Compare with yum.
